meanings.definition: A sliding door used in traditional Japanese architecture to partition rooms.
meanings.sent1: The fusuma separated the living room from the bedroom.
meanings.sent2: In Japanese houses, you can slide the fusuma to create different room configurations.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat tried to slide the fusuma but got stuck halfway.
meanings.sent4: Her silence was like a closed fusuma, hiding her true feelings from everyone.
meanings.sent5: The intricate patterns on the fusuma added elegance to the room.

meanings.definition: A type of door panel used in Japanese homes for privacy and decoration.
meanings.sent1: The fusuma in the house had beautiful painted designs.
meanings.sent2: She closed the fusuma to have some privacy in her room.
meanings.sent3: The children played hide-and-seek behind the fusuma, giggling.
meanings.sent4: His thoughts were like colorful fusuma panels, each one hiding a different idea.
meanings.sent5: The soft light filtered through the fusuma, creating a warm glow in the room.
